title: Police launch probe into false audio clip on ‘Clean Sri Lanka’ program
byline: Sri Lanka Police have confirmed that an audio clip currently circulating on social media, claiming to be a “special announcement in line with the government’s Clean Sri Lanka – 2025 program”, is a fake.

title: Fire at food market in northern China kills at least 8 and injures 15
byline: A fire at a food market Saturday in northern China killed at least eight people and injured 15 others, state media said.

title: Navy seizes over 11kg of gold being smuggled by boat
byline: A special search operation conducted by the Navy in the sea area off the Baththalangunduwa Island, Kalpitiya on Saturday (4), has led to the interception of a dinghy with 03 suspects who were smuggling around 11kg and 300g of gold.

title: More details revealed on Weligama shooting incident
byline: Police have recovered a motorcycle suspected to have been used by the suspects who carried out the shooting incident that took place at Weligama, Matara this morning (04).

title: World’s oldest person Tomiko Itooka dies at 116 in Japan
byline: A Japanese woman, recognised as the world’s oldest person by Guinness World Records, has died aged 116.

title: 2024 Scholarship Exam paper marking to resume from Jan 8
byline: The Department of Examinations has announced that the paper marking process for the 2024 Grade 05 Scholarship Examination, which was the subject of recent controversy, will resume next week.

title: Russia vows retaliation after saying it downed eight US-made long-range missiles
byline: Russia has vowed retaliation after claiming to have shot down eight US-made ATACMS missiles fired by Ukraine on Saturday morning.

title: Sri Lanka targets 3 million tourists in 2025 amid economic recovery
byline: Sri Lanka is poised to make a significant leap in its tourism industry, aiming for 3 million tourist arrivals in 2025. This ambitious target comes on the heels of a projected 2.1 million visitors in 2024 as the nation steadily recovers from the economic challenges it faced in recent years.

title: Misty conditions expected during the morning
byline: The Meteorological Department said that showers or thundershowers will occur at several places in Sabaragamuwa, Southern and Uva provinces and in Kaluthara, Kandy and Nuwara-Eliya districts during the afternoon or night today (05).

title: Sri Lanka to review Adani’s energy projects tomorrow
byline: A proposal to appoint a committee to evaluate Adani Group’s wind energy projects in Sri Lanka is slated to be tabled at the Cabinet meeting scheduled for tomorrow (06), according to a spokesperson from the Ministry of Energy.

title: Suspect arrested at BIA for smuggling gold
byline: The Airport Police have arrested a suspect at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake for illegally smuggling gold into the country. MORE

title: Biden plans to send $8bn arms shipment to Israel
byline: The US Department of State has notified Congress of a planned $8bn (£6.4bn) arms sale to Israel, an American official has confirmed to the BBC.

title: Two arrested in Seenigama with grenades, pistol and ammunition
byline: Two persons have been arrested by the Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB) in the Seenigama area for the possession of two grenades, an 8mm pistol, 66 rounds of T-56 ammunition and 55 rounds for 9mm ammunition.

title: Sri Lanka Police launch special two-week traffic operations
byline: Sri Lanka Police have taken steps to implement two traffic operations aimed at reducing road accidents and easing traffic congestion, in line with the ‘Clean Sri Lanka’ national initiative.

title: Golden Globes kicks off the awards party tonight
byline: Angelina Jolie, Adrien Brody, Timothee Chalamet, Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo are some of the stars in the running for acting awards at this year’s Golden Globes, which take place in LA later today.

title: Tax evasion by top earners to blame for revenue shortfalls: Experts
byline: Tax expert N.R. Gajendran says Sri Lanka’s inability to meet tax revenue targets despite tax hikes is due to the tax leakages spurred by tax evasion.

title: President and AG to discuss progress of controversial cases
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake will reportedly meet with the Attorney General (AG) tomorrow (06).

title: Govt. decides not to liquidate ‘Thriposha’ Company
byline: The government has announced its commitment to continue operating the ‘Thriposha’ Company in Kandana as a state-owned institution, with plans to renovate and develop the facility to better serve the nutritional needs of the people.

title: New guidelines issued on unpaid leaves for public officials
byline: The Ministry of Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils and Local Government of Sri Lanka has issued a special notice to all District Secretaries , outlining the guidelines for approving domestic and foreign unpaid leave for public officials without affecting their pension entitlements.

title: CPC chairman files Rs. 500M defamation case against Ananda Palitha
byline: The Chairman of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC), D.J. Rajakaruna has initiated legal action against Ananda Palitha, a trade union leader affiliated with the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB), over defamation.

title: Sri Lanka deploys GPS technology to address human-elephant conflict
byline: The Department of Wildlife Conservation has initiated an operation to use GPS technology in managing the movement of wild elephants from several areas in Anuradhapura to the Wilpattu National Park.

title: Nagasaki atomic bomb survivor, who devoted his life for peace, dies at 93
byline: Shigemi Fukahori, a survivor of the 1945 Nagasaki atomic bombing, who devoted his life to advocating for peace has died. He was 93.
